greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least k such that 2^n+1+k is a prime.
example: a(5)=4 because 2^5+1+4=37 that is a prime.
program: (PARI) a(n) = k = 0; while (! isprime(2^n+k+1), k++); k; \\ _Michel Marcus_, Sep 27 2013
results.author: _Felice Russo_
